Q-statements: Early warning messages are crucial to our survival.
I am afraid someone will steal my belongings.
One can never know whether you will reach the shelter safely.
Women are not safe in the shelter.
If people in the village told me to evacuate I would go.
The outcome is not in my hands.
I will not leave my valuables behind.
Something could happen to my family.
People normally tell me when to evacuate.
The disaster training is helpful.
I only go when I see others evacuate.
One should never leave their family behind.
I know just how to prepare when I see an early warning flag.
I feel safe after reaching the shelter.
Evacuating is the right thing to do.
I am afraid of dying in the cyclone strikes.
I am better off because my valuables can be taken into the shelter.

There is no point going to the shelter.

My place is at home.

God decides who lives and dies.

Lack of time is the main problem.

When a volunteer tells me to evacuate I will.
